dim:dim.dim:field: Michigan Public Media. University of Michigan

Originally aired on June 25, 2010. Feature 1: Dr. Victor Strecher is the U-M Distinguished University Innovator for 2010. He is a professor of health behavior and health education in the School of Public Health, professor of health behavior in the Department of Family Medicine in the Medical School, and also a successful entrepreneur, having launched HealthMedia in 1998. We learn about his work and how it is inspired by personal experience. Feature 2: Catherine Badgley is an Assistant Professor of Ecology and Evolutionary Biology whose research into crop yields from organic farming versus large, agri-business farming has turned common assumptions on their head. Her research indicates that organic farming actually yields more produce per acre than "traditional," large-scale agri-business farming that uses pesticides, herbicides and genetically modified crops. Feature 3: The University of Michigan Women's Rowing team is not only accomplished athletically, they're accomplished academically as well. Currently ranked 11th in the country in their sport, they also have a roster filled with student/athletes who have won numerous University, Big Ten and national academic honors.
Copyright is held by the Board of Regents, University of Michigan.
Dr. Victor Strecher (Director - Center for Health Education Research, School of Public Health)
Shannon Considine (Health Behavioralist - Center for Health Communications Research)
Dr. Kenneth Warner (Dean - School of Public Health)
Dr. Catherine Badgley (Department of Ecology and Evolutionary Biology)
The collection is open for research
Out of the Blue: The Michigan Difference (television program)

mets:FLocat.xlink:label: Episode includes: Dr. Victor Strecher, the U-M Distinguished University Innovator for 2010; Dr. Catherine Badgley's research indicates that organic farming yields more produce per acre than traditional farming; and the U-M Women's Rowing team, which has a roster filled with student/athletes who have won numerous University, Big Ten and national academic honors
